articles.title: Ice Sheets and Ocean Tides Interactions Also Contribute to Glacier Melt: Study | Weather.com - The Weather Channel
articles.description: The warm water intrusion from the ocean carved a gigantic cavity about 670 feet tall in Petermann glacier's underside.
articles.content:
If you were to look at Greenland's glaciers from above, without the context of their precarious situation, you would only find a serene, snowy expanse stretching out as far as you could see.
